deleteConversation example for exporting from backend code

docs.summary: Retrieves a conversation by conversation ID.
description: If you don't have the conversation ID, use `getOrCreateConversation()` to retrieve the conversation using the visitor, contact, or member ID.

examples.title: Get a conversation (export from backend code)

params.name: participantId
params.doc: ID of the visitor, contact, or member chatting with the business.

docs.summary: Retrieves a conversation by the specified visitor, contact, or member ID. If the conversation does not exist for the provided visitor, contact, or member, the function creates a new conversation.

examples.title: Get or create a conversation from a member (dashboard page code)
Get or create a conversation from a member (export from backend code)
Get or create a new conversation with a member

extra.description: The page code passes input values submitted by a logged-in member to the backend `sendFormData` function. This function retrieves the logged-in member ID, gets an existing or creates a new converation object and uses the conversation ID to send a form message to the site owner's inbox dashboard.

examples.title: Get or create a conversation with a contact

extra.description: This code registers an event listener in the `events.js` file that triggers when a new contact is created. The event handler calls `getOrCreateConversation()` to generate or retrieve a conversation. It then sends a thank-you message in the `wix-chat` widget.

examples.title: Get or create a conversation with anonymousVisitorId
Get or create a conversation from a contact
Get or create a conversation from a site visitor

extra.description: This code detects a when a site visitor likes a blog post by registering the `onPostLiked` event listener in the `events.js` file. This event triggers an event object containing the `anonymousVisitorId`, which is  passed as an argument to `getOrCreateConversationIdFromVisitor`. The conversationId is returned and passed as a parameter to `sendMinimal`, which sends a minimal message to the site owner's inbox dashboard.

members.name: oldChatroomIds
members.doc: old chatroom ids

members.name: targetChatroomId
members.doc: new chatroom id

members.name: _id
members.doc: Conversation ID.

members.name: businessDisplayData
members.doc: Display name and avatar for the business.

members.name: channels
members.doc: List of communication channels where the visitor, contact, or member can receive messages.

members.name: participant
members.doc: ID of the visitor, contact, or member who is chatting with the business.

members.name: participantDisplayData
members.doc: Display name and avatar for the visitor, contact, or member.

members.name: channel
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'AI_ASSISTANT'`
- `'CHAT'`
- `'EMAIL'`
- `'FACEBOOK'`
- `'INSTAGRAM'`
- `'PHONE'`
- `'SMS'`
- `'UNKNOWN_CHANNEL_TYPE'`
- `'WHATSAPP'`

members.name: recipients
members.doc: TODO rename? - Shalom

members.name: imageUrl
members.doc: Avatar image URL.

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name.

members.name: oldConversationIds
members.doc: List of old conversation IDs.

members.name: targetConversationId
members.doc: New conversation ID.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: conversationId
members.doc: Conversation ID.

members.name: conversation
members.doc: Retrieved conversation.

members.name: participantId
members.doc:
ID of the visitor, contact, or member chatting with the business.

Required for 3rd-party apps.

members.name: conversation
members.doc: Created or retrieved conversation.

members.name: newConversation
members.doc:
Indicates whether the conversation previously exists or was just created.

If `true`, the conversation was just created.
If `false`, the conversation already existed.

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of an anonymous site visitor.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: ID of a site contact.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of a site member.

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of an anonymous site visitor.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of a site member.

members.name: sorting
members.doc: only message time is supported for field name

members.name: sorting
members.doc: only message time is supported for field name

members.name: data
members.doc: Stringify payload.

members.name: eventType
members.doc: Event type.

members.name: identity
members.doc: The identification type and identity data.

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: App instance ID.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of an anonymous site visitor.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: ID of a site contact.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of a site member.

members.name: memberId
members.doc: ID of a site member.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: anonymousVisitorId
members.doc: ID of a site visitor that has not logged in to the site.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of an app.

members.name: identityType
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ANONYMOUS_VISITOR'`
- `'APP'`
- `'MEMBER'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`
- `'WIX_USER'`
